months.summary: In August, the student will learn about different **Number Systems** and how to perform operations on **Whole Numbers**. They will also explore **Factors and Multiples**, which is crucial for understanding prime numbers and simplifying fractions later in the year.

September focuses on **Fractions**, including addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Students will also learn about **Decimal Operations** and **Rational Numbers**, enhancing their number sense and preparing them for more complex calculations involving fractions and decimals.

In October, the emphasis will be on **Ratios and Proportions** and their applications in solving real-world problems. Students will also explore **Percentages** and begin learning how to simplify **Algebraic Expressions**, setting a strong foundation for algebra concepts in later months.

November introduces **Integers and Absolute Value**, where students will learn to navigate positive and negative numbers. They will revisit the **Order of Operations** and start **Solving Equations**, which is vital for succeeding in algebra.

December's focus is on the basics of **Geometry**, including types of **Angles** and calculating **Perimeter and Area** for various geometric shapes. Understanding these concepts will aid students in visualizing problems in mathematics.

In January, students will study **Data and Statistics**, learning how to calculate **Mean, Median, and Mode**. They will also learn to represent data using different types of **Graphs**, which are essential skills for interpreting real-world data.

February will delve into **Probability**, where students will engage in **Simple Experiments** and learn about **Compound Events**. These concepts are important for decision-making and understanding chance in everyday situations.

In March, the curriculum will cover **Basic Algebra Concepts**, including **Inequalities** and the introduction to **Functions**. Grasping these concepts is essential for higher-level math courses and real-world applications.

April focuses on **Measurement** and understanding various **Units of Measure**. Students will also practice **Conversions** between different units, skills that are useful in daily life and in scientific contexts.

May is dedicated to reviewing all the topics learned throughout the year and reinforcing those concepts through **Practical Applications**. This will help the student to consolidate their knowledge and see how math is used in real-life scenarios.
